main event: Unidentified objects were tracked on radar and visually observed over St. George's Bay, Newfoundland on August 30, 1950.
interesting points: Radar detected an object traveling at 30 to 60 mph at an altitude of 5 to 6 thousand feet., The object was described as round, black or dark in color, and about the size of a basketball., Three Newfoundland native employees at Ernest Harmon AFB reported seeing the object for approximately 15 minutes., The object's behavior suggested it was possibly a balloon or some atmospheric object., Witnesses rated as reliable by the USAF had no military experience but were familiar with similar balloon objects.
sighted object: Unidentified flying object, round and dark-colored
witness description: Newfoundland native employees of the Motor Transport Division, ages 28, 34, and 35
